channel.title: Hyperion server project annihilation error
channel.description:

java.util.ArrayList required-type : org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition path : /list/objectDefinition line number : 2 ------------------------------- at gExecutorService.java:50) at org.hyperion.rs2.RS2Server.start(RS2Server.java:74) at org.hyperion.Server.main(Server.java:36) Caused by: com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot const ruct org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition as it does not have a no-args c onstructor : Cannot construct org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefinition as it does not have a no-args constructor ---- Debugging information ---- message : Cannot construct org.hyperion.rs2.model.GameObjectDefiniti on as it does not have a no-args constructor cause-exception : opulateCollection(CollectionConverter.java:68) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.CollectionConverter.u nmarshal(CollectionConverter.java:61) at item.title: Hyperion server project annihilation error
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

You’re missing a bracket somewhere. Eclipse can help you fix that.

Read full topic

I fixed the compiler, this is what i got… i put this as my compiler
@echo off
Title Compiler
echo Compiling…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion server project annihilation error
item.dc:creator: @Crown2 Crown2
item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:32, topic:438834”][quote author=shank beast link=topic=541542.msg3967391#msg3967391 date=1333845749]

make sure the ports are the same also port in server is in rs2server.java in client its in client.java

here is the client you should use http://www.mediafire.com/?zpuqk84993x5io8

extract it and go into client.java search for
Class60.aString1289 =

make it look like
Class60.aString1289 = “127.0.0.1”;
compile and run

Ok thanks you but, can i get a working Compiler, this one isnt working :9

‘javac’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .

@echo off
title Compiling…
cd src
javac -cp . -d …/bin/ ./rs/*.java
pause
[/quote]
Your environment variables aren’t set. Search for the environment variable setter on these forums in the search bar[/quote]

yup set the variables your self - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html
or use the auto setter - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=375681.0

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion server project annihilation error
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“shank beast, post:27, topic:438834”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=541542.msg3967364#msg3967364 date=1333841443]

Thanks so much, you really worked up. now, last thing what client can i use for this?

theres a client reupload link on the last page of the origian l thread

Thanks and ok this is the last question, where is the ip found? when i run it while running server it doesnt load…

Not sure, search for “server =” or “serverip =” in all files with notepad++ or something

is there maybe a anti leech to this? or you know for sure there isnt

The other stuff was the anti-leech. There shouldn’t be one in the client
[/quote]
i think there is a anti leech connecting to server, the client won’t load. error_game_js5connect[/quote]
That error usually means that the server isn’t running or the client is connecting to the wrong IP

Read full topic

item.description:

okay here step by step

  1. Download this - https://nexus.codehaus.org/content/repositories/releases/com/thoughtworks/xstream/xstream/1.4.2/xstream-1.4.2.jar

  2. Go to Project Annihilation Folder and into the lib folder

  3. Replace the name of the xstream-1.4.2.jar to xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar

  4. cop the jar you just replaced the name of into the lib folder and replace it

  5. done

search for d:\npcDefinitionsEPICSHIT1337.xml and replace it with ./data/npcDefinitions.xml
